description: Borrowed from Middle French intuitif, from Medieval Latin intuitivus, from Latin intueri.

adjectives.description: intuitive (comparative more intuitive, superlative most intuitive)

examples: These impressions [of potential papal candidates], collected from interviews with a variety of church officials and experts, may influence the very intuitive, often unpredictable process the cardinals will use to decide who should lead the worldâ€™s largest church.

entries.meaning: Easily understood or grasped by intuition.
examples: Designing software with an intuitive interface can be difficult.

entries.meaning: Having a marked degree of intuition.
